basic.floral_language:
Mammillaria herrerae
Floriography: lovely, warm-hearted, noble
Is a relatively rare succulent, named because the plant is covered by white thorns.
Has spherical stems, thick and fleshy, covered by short and soft white thorns, very lovely. Easy to grow, often placed on a desk, coffee table, in bedrooms or offices.
Likes sunny places, has a summer dormancy, need put under bright scattered light. Blooms with pink flowers under right conditions.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, pink flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green, covered by soft white spines

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, a short period of dormancy in summer, put in places with bright scattered light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce watering when in summer dormancy
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once monthly in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
